alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 3:18PM MDT until August 09 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE MCBRIDE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 318 PM MDT, Emergency management reported flash flooding from heavy rain over the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen, and while heavy rainfall has ended, continued runoff and possible debris flows are expected through the late afternoon. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road, Blue Lake Drive, Eagle Creek Canyon Road and areas downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported high water levels and flash flooding in drainages surrounding Gavilan Canyon Road. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and possible debris flows in and around the McBride Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
